title: The matrix multiplication
content: This section is about the multiplication of m x n matrices.

blocks.name: cmmul
blocks.content: Syntax for the matrix multiplication operator.
blocks.origin: const class cmmul { maMul }

blocks.name: diff.cmmul.s
diff.cmmul.c
diff.cmmul.w
df-mamu
blocks.content: The operator which multiplies an m x n matrix with an n x p matrix, see also the definition in [Lang] p. 504. Note that it is not generally possible to recover the dimensions from the matrix, since all n x 0 and all 0 x n matrices are represented by the empty set. (Contributed by Stefan O'Rear, 4-Sep-2015.)

blocks.name: mamuval
blocks.content: Multiplication of two matrices. (Contributed by Stefan O'Rear, 2-Sep-2015.)

blocks.name: mamufacex
blocks.content: Every solution of the equation ` A * X = B ` for matrices ` A ` and ` B ` is a matrix. (Contributed by AV, 10-Feb-2019.)

blocks.name: mamures
blocks.content: Rows in a matrix product are functions only of the corresponding rows in the left argument. (Contributed by SO, 9-Jul-2018.)

thm mamures(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, class c6, class c7, class c8, class c9, class c10, wff w0) {

  syl2anc(w0, wceq(cres(cmpo(hs0, hs1, c8, c4, co(c7, cgsu, cmpt(hs2, c5, co(co(cv(hs0), c0, cv(hs2)), cfv(cmulr, c7), co(cv(hs2), c2, cv(hs1)))))), cxp(c3, c4)), cmpo(hs0, hs1, c3, c4, co(c7, cgsu, cmpt(hs2, c5, co(co(cv(hs0), c0, cv(hs2)), cfv(cmulr, c7), co(cv(hs2), c2, cv(hs1))))))), wss(c3, c8), wss(c4, c4))
  ssidd(c4, w0)
  resmpt2(hs0, hs1, c3, c8, c4, c4, co(c7, cgsu, cmpt(hs2, c5, co(co(cv(hs0), c0, cv(hs2)), cfv(cmulr, c7), co(cv(hs2), c2, cv(hs1))))))
  mpt2eq3dva(hs0, hs1, c3, c4, co(c7, cgsu, cmpt(hs2, c5, co(co(cv(hs0), c0, cv(hs2)), cfv(cmulr, c7), co(cv(hs2), c2, cv(hs1))))), co(c7, cgsu, cmpt(hs2, c5, co(co(cv(hs0), cres(c0, cxp(c3, c5)), cv(hs2)), cfv(cmulr, c7), co(cv(hs2), c2, cv(hs1))))), w0)
  oveq2d(c7, cgsu, cmpt(hs2, c5, co(co(cv(hs0), c0, cv(hs2)), cfv(cmulr, c7), co(cv(hs2), c2, cv(hs1)))), cmpt(hs2, c5, co(co(cv(hs0), cres(c0, cxp(c3, c5)), cv(hs2)), cfv(cmulr, c7), co(cv(hs2), c2, cv(hs1)))), w3a(w0, wcel(cv(hs0), c3), wcel(cv(hs1), c4)))
  mpteq2dva(hs2, c5, co(co(cv(hs0), c0, cv(hs2)), cfv(cmulr, c7), co(cv(hs2), c2, cv(hs1))), co(co(cv(hs0), cres(c0, cxp(c3, c5)), cv(hs2)), cfv(cmulr, c7), co(cv(hs2), c2, cv(hs1))), w3a(w0, wcel(cv(hs0), c3), wcel(cv(hs1), c4)))

thm gsumcom3(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, class c6, class c7, class c8, wff w0) {
  |- wi(w0, wceq(co(c0, cgsu, cmpt(s0, c1, co(c0, cgsu, cmpt(s1, c2, c3)))), co(c0, cgsu, cmpt(s1, c2, co(c0, cgsu, cmpt(s0, c1, c3))))))
  -| wceq(c4, cfv(cbs, c0))
  -| wceq(c5, cfv(c0g, c0))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c0, ccmn))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c1, c6))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c2, c7))

  ‚ä¢ (w0 ‚Üí(c0[gsum](s0 ‚àà c1 ‚Ü¶(c0[gsum](s1 ‚àà c2 ‚Ü¶ c3))))=(c0[gsum](s1 ‚àà c2 ‚Ü¶(c0[gsum](s0 ‚àà c1 ‚Ü¶ c3)))))

blocks.name: mamuass
blocks.content: Matrix multiplication is associative, see also statement in [Lang] p. 505. (Contributed by Stefan O'Rear, 5-Sep-2015.)

blocks.name: mamudi
blocks.content: Matrix multiplication distributes over addition on the left. (Contributed by Stefan O'Rear, 5-Sep-2015.) (Proof shortened by AV, 23-Jul-2019.)
blocks.origin:
thm mamudi(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, class c6, class c7, class c8, class c9, wff w0) {
  |- wi(w0, wceq(co(co(c0, cof(c1), c2), c3, c4), co(co(c0, c3, c4), cof(c1), co(c2, c3, c4))))
  -| wceq(c5, cfv(cbs, c6))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c6, crg))
  -| wceq(c3, co(c6, cmmul, cotp(c7, c8, c9)))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c7, cfn))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c8, cfn))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c9, cfn))
  -| wceq(c1, cfv(cplusg, c6))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c0, co(c5, cmap, cxp(c7, c8))))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c2, co(c5, cmap, cxp(c7, c8))))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c4, co(c5, cmap, cxp(c8, c9))))
} = {
  mpbird(w0, wceq(co(co(c0, cof(c1), c2), c3, c4), co(co(c0, c3, c4), cof(c1), co(c2, c3, c4))), wral(hs0, c7, wral(hs1, c9, wceq(co(cv(hs0), co(co(c0, cof(c1), c2), c3, c4), cv(hs1)), co(cv(hs0), co(co(c0, c3, c4), cof(c1), co(c2, c3, c4)), cv(hs1))))))

blocks.name: mamudir
blocks.content: Matrix multiplication distributes over addition on the right. (Contributed by Stefan O'Rear, 5-Sep-2015.) (Proof shortened by AV, 23-Jul-2019.)

blocks.name: mamuvs1
blocks.content: Matrix multiplication distributes over scalar multiplication on the left. (Contributed by Stefan O'Rear, 5-Sep-2015.)

blocks.name: mamuvs2
blocks.content: Matrix multiplication distributes over scalar multiplication on the left. (Contributed by Stefan O'Rear, 5-Sep-2015.) (Proof shortened by AV, 22-Jul-2019.)
